title: Few things
body:
So the new client looks amazing, it feels smooth and has the new league feel that i think they are trying to bring in.

I just finished a game of aram, a few things i noticed was the chat box didnt have a clear indication as to how big it was, it just cuts half the words, i also feel like the chat box is a bit on the small side.
i dont know if it is a feature to be added later, but removing thew stats from the end game, in my opinion, is a big mistake. i dont know if they are trying to push people to go to the out of client match history to view further stats, and if they are, i feel like it is the wrong approach.

apart from those few things, new clients looks amazing and could really get used to it.

replies.body: Also for some reason I can never access the OCE match history, which makes those in-client end game stats even more important for me.

Agree with you. Just finished SR and for more detailed stats i had to go and open internet browser, which is annoying as it was a good feature on old client. And chat window could have been a bit bigger so i wouldn't need to look for it with magnifying glass. Other than that, looks really cool.

Edit: Also there is no "quit" button at champion select screen and for what ever reason i need to abandon the game, i  need to shut down the client itself. It would be nice to have a "quit" button like on custom games, so i wont need to restart the LoL client and relog back to the game. Also also on champion select when you arrange champions by their class (marksmen, tank and etc.) there is no option to go back to have ALL champions back on selection screen. So once you pressed a class group, no going back to see all champs or did i miss something there.
